article.headline: Massachusetts, 101, Duquesne 87
article.story: AMHERST, Mass. (AP) -- James Life nailed 24 points and Gary Forbes piled 19 to lift Massachusetts to a 101-87 win over Duquesne in an Atlantic-10 Conference action Sunday. Stephane Lasme and Chris Lowe had 14 points apiece and Ricky Harris scored 13 to give UMass (14-5, 4-1 Atlantic-10) the first century scoring mark at home in 14 years. Reggie Jackson and Robert Mitchell scored 22 points each and Kieron Achara had 17 for the Dukes (5-11, 1-4 A-10), who trailed 43-41 at halftime. UMass' depth was displayed in the second half, with 10 different players scoring. The Dukes had pulled within three, 61-68, with 10:48 to play on a Achara lay-up. UMass then outscored Duquesne 40-29 from that point forward to crack the 100-point mark. UMass shot 47 percent for the game, hitting 35-of-74 shots from the floor. Duquesne hit 32-of-76 from the floor, or 42 percent.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
